receiver-org.narrative: NACGOND is a coalition of 26 NGOs, CSO, Ethnic Nationality Organizations and the academia based in Port Harcourt Nigeria working on strengthening environmental governance issues through lobby and advocacy.

condition.narrative: Niger Delta women are the most impacted by the pollution and contamination occasioned by oil spills and gas flaring, yet they remain at the background of the environmental justice discourse, mostly as a result of the patriarchal social structure of the region. In order to change the status quo, and articulate gender inclusion in environmental justice advocacy, a Women’s Social Forum was unavoidable. NACGOND gave vent to this discourse by facilitation a Social Forum for Niger Delta Women, in which issues of environmental degradation and its impact on women were brought to the fore, by women themselves.

description.narrative: Prior to the inception of this intervention, Niger Delta women’s voices on issues of environmental justice were in splinters, with pockets of women led organizations working independently, without a common front. This made it difficult to amplify their voices as was required to project the impact of high level environmental pollution on Niger Delta women and their livelihoods.

title.narrative: Number of women-based organisations involved in movements for environmental justice in the Niger Delta region.

description.narrative: Niger Delta women begin to demand for safe environment, free of oil and gas pollution.

baseline.value: Absence or low level of involvement of women-based organisations in environmental justice advocacy in the Niger Delta. This stalled the inclusion of women’s issues in environmental management policies of the region.

location.ref: Parts of Cross River, Akwa Ibom, Rivers, Abia, Bayelsa and Delta States in South-South Nigeria

comment.narrative: Activities of mostly individual Women members of NACGOND coalition have greatly escalated women led environmental justice campaigns arising from the one-off social forum. There is sustained consciousness among many women led organizations in the Niger Delta championing voices on issues of environmental policy and governance in the Niger Delta region.
